feed.title: Web of Origins
feed.subtitle: Mapping products, materials, ingredients, industries, and impacts.

entry.title: Tracing Coffee Origins
entry.content:
test Exploring coffee’s supply chain, linked to nodes like Coffee, Brazil, and impacts like Deforestation. View visualization.

For a primary SCSS/SASS file (like a main.scss or style.scss that will eventually become a full CSS file) that you want Jekyll to render to a .css file, you must include the front matter, but it can be empty.

If you’d like, I can show you a simple structure that combines your universal styles.css and your Jekyll overrides cleanly inside the _sass pipeline (so you maintain just one style system). Would you like that setup example?
